comments.body:
Russia:
Weeply's (ВиплиУипли/Выпли) - большую часть времени проводят сидя в плакучей лозе. Сидят внутри также, как и пчёлы.
Плакучая лоза растёт только, если Weeply's находятся в ней.
Если плакучей лозы рядом нет, Weeply's будут просто летать по округе, не отходя далеко от места, где они в последний раз видели плакучую лозу.
Чтобы перетащить Weeply's на другое место, достаточно держать в руке плакучую лозу.
Так вести Weeply's за собой в то место, где хочется их оставить.
При убийстве падает светокаменная пыль.
Плакучая лоза может использоваться для крафта. Если положить в один слот верстака плакучую лозу, то можно получить 2 кусочка светогриба.
На текстуре плакучей лозы заметны маленькие светлые пятна. Это вполне могут быть кусочки светогриба, которые опали сверху прямо на лозу.
Также, Weeply's освещают местность вокруг себя, в расстоянии 2-3 блоков.
Спавнятся группами 3-4 особи. Для роста плакучей лозы необходимо, чтобы в ней находилось именно 4 Weeply's.
Существо нейтрально и не испытывает агрессии ни к какому другому мобу. Способно лишь ослепить игрока, но только в случае атаки.

Плюсы:
1) Данное существо поможет сделать Нижний мир совсем чуть-чуть более жутким! Ведь каждый немного пугался, когда из блока на него вырывалась Чешуйница.
2) Дополнит Багровый лес! Ведь хорошо подходит по цветам окружению данного биома. А ещё хорошо подходит текстуре частиц этого биома.
3) И сделает Плакучую лозу довольно полезной!
ЕТО ПРИКОЛЬНО Я ОТ ЖЕКИ
A Sword-billed hummingbird would attack mobs (like protecting player?), by flying very quick straight into an enemy.
yeh gud idae
They should spawn in jungle and flower forest biomes and accelerate the growth of crops like bees. They should also be more attracted to red flowers than other colors, like in real life.
You could also craft sugar water to tame and breed them with.
Maybe you can tame them with nectar gained from right-clicking flowers with empty glass bottles.
they could pollenate plants and you can get a really fancy advancement for catching one and all types since they are super fast
Hummingbirds don't seem super useful, but they could be! Maybe when killed, they could drop a music disc. And you could feed them honey to make them breed.

Hummingbirds would be so cute! They could have their own spawn egg and biome variations!

 

Birch: Ruby-throated Hummingbird (RTH)

Cherry Blossom Grove: RTH and Anna’s Hummingbird

Desert: Costa’s Hummingbird and Black-chinned Hummingbird

Flower Forest: RTH, White-chested Emerald, and Purple-throated Woodstar

Jungle: Green-throated Mango, Rufous-crested Coquette, Fork-tailed Woodnyphm, and RTH

Mangrove Swamps: Mangrove Hummingbird

(Oak) Forest: RTH

Savanna: Swallow-tailed Hummingbird

I think this is a great idea for many reasons.

  1. Silverfish spawners are rare but almost always destroyed as they serve no purpose other than adding challenge midgame when the player is about to fight the dragon. This will make the spawners a reward.
  2. Husks and stays dont feel different enough from skelletons and zombies to be worth farming for most players. Adding sand drops to husks and even something like ice to the stray will help show that husks and strays are different mobs and not just varients of common zombies and skelletons.
  3. With the addition of concrete sand and gravel have a lot higher value than before. Concrete is often used in large amounts making collecting sand and gravel very grindy and demotivating for some player and hindering their creativity. This is especialy true with gravel as it was not that important untill concrete was added. This has the negative side effect of the biomes not made originaly to make it easy to collect gravel as it was not important. I often see on servers people running out of gravel very easily unless they use some sort of biome finding program as gravel containing biomes are pretty rare.
  4. Adding these loot tables will also give technical players another option for obtaining these blocks. This allows players to not have to reley on exploits to farm these blocks on both bedrock edition and java edition. This is important on bedrock because duplicating these blocks using end portals was patched. A mechanic that has been on java for a while.

After 1.16, gravel is technically renewable, but I don't want to give gold for renewable gravel, I like the silverfish gravel drop much better. I also like the husk sand drop much better than giving wandering traders emeralds for it. Sand and gravel are early game necessities like cobblestone, so they should be easier to get. Also, maybe husks can drop an ingredient for a potion or something so people actually want to kill them for bigger purposes. For example, it could drop a tooth that could be used to make resistance potions.
This would be great and pays a bit of homage to those end portal dupers since silverfish spawners only generate in strongholds.
Brilliant!
I don’t understand what you are saying, but I believe it would work with chickens

yah

that wold be vary cool
The iron Holmes should have a spawn egg to make iron golem farms easier and make it faster to produce more iron.
even horses? cows?
thats unecessary bro
That sounds pretty cool
Perfect idea
This is non-negotiable. This is perfect
Good idea
Indeed. Capybara

Pardon me, but I disagree on your statement that no more words are needed. We need t o think about some more details. For instance, where would the capybaras live? Would they drop something if killed? If so, what would they drop? What would separate the capybaras from other mobs? Would they live in groups, or be solitary? Would they be hostile, neutral, or passive mobs? Would you be able to breed them? If so, what would you use? Would they be tamable? If not, would you be able to befriend them like you can with foxes? Would they run from players? Would they stay mainly in water, or on land? (Real capybaras live on both) Would they attack and eat fish, like the cat does for rabbits? Would any mobs try to attack the capybaras? If so, which mobs?

While I realize that not all of the above questions need to be answered by the author of the post, it would be nice to have some more information about how the capybara would interact with a Minecraft world.
yes it fits for the first rodent in the game to be the biggest one there is!

No to bended legs, but yes to climbing. Having Spiders' bodies pivot when they go up a wall has already been handled in mods. Even better, people have let them cling to ceilings in the same way, and it adds an excellent dynamic to cave exploration!
That would be too scary for me sorry
Yes! It's been so long I've started to just accept this. It would be so cool to see this classic mob updated with modern animations!
Wow I am totally with you on that as it gives the game logic
If this gets added to the game why not add a bigger variety of spiders? Maybe even a spider boss
In my opinion spiders should be removed as arachnophobia is quite common and forces some people to play Minecraft in Peaceful mode.

If Mojang could go back and update the old mobs, like they currently are with the bat, I would love to see spiders that crawl on walls and ceilings.

Maybe spiders could also have nests with webs (instead of the cave spider spawners).
This would add so much life to the ocean. Voted!

Really nice idea! And maybe even some sort of assistance against the Elder Guardian (although that's a stretch, it's already easy to cheese the Elder Guardian and moreso with Axolotls...) or anti-miner's fatigue. Actually that gives me an idea that the potion you should be able to craft from its drops could be a Mining Haste potion (especially underwater)?

But anyway, I'm just getting really desperate for features for the creature to have that justify it being voted over Iceologer or Moobloom, both of which I would prefer having...
Really cool idea! Eggs can be picked up by mining them with silk touch, just like turtle eggs.

Great idea! Can you give me a rundown on what kind of functionality these would provide? Obviously they interact with the parrots, but do they have any special recipes or cool functions? I would like to know!
Awesome idea! You could hatch the egg by placing it by a fire or under the parents.
Good idea, when the egg was broken can spawn a baby parrot. You can add more differenti type of parrot like ara or parakeet
Good idea, when the egg was broken can spawn a baby parrot. You can add more differenti type of parrot like ara or parakeet

I love this idea, it's unique and gives a reason to protect your horses/build enclosures. Though maybe it shouldn't stop there.

But in order to make this truly useful, I think phantoms should spawn uncommonly and not just when you don't sleep for a while, similar to Witches or Endermen. This fixes phantom spawning issues and introduces a new flying mob.

This abundance of a new flying animal adds something else too, a reason to build shelter for your animals.

Imagine if that instead of targeting players they should attack all domesticated animals, this means that cows, sheep, chickens and pigs would need protection, encouraging defensive building. On top of this phantoms could deal damage to all the mobs it swoops next to, encouraging spaced out building and housing for mobs.

This gives a new reason for defensive building and adds some much needed danger from the empty skies.

I very much agree with aslangames, as a big issue I have with survival mode is the lack of reason to build. I know all players aren’t devoted builders, but it would make the game‘s environment feel so much more alive if animals reacted with each other, such as horses being scared of phantoms.
I think it would be cool if they added the ability to put a saddle on the Hoglin. Then we could have bull riding mini games because the Hoglins dislike players.

The hoglins would jump constantly and ram into walls unless you craft savory fungi if you give a hoglin one they act like a wolf and are rideable it is crafted by surrounding crimson fungus with rotten flesh holding it would give you the nausea effect.

That'd be so adorable! It'd be cool if they did it while being told to stay too

I love it!
This would be so cute.
This would be so great!
WOW

Maybe we should have to travel to the end or possibly a new alien realm to find aliens. Aliens could be hostile and killing them could add new drop items to the game, maybe different alien colors or breeds too! Also being able to ride a UFO would be awesome! I love this idea!!!
This would take away the Medeival effect from Minecraft. I like the idea but it just wouldn't work with Minecraft. Besides, Enderman exist.

But the main thing would to be adding a new planet/dimension lore about about an alien planet then add ruins of crashed space ship. Space ship being dungeon with aliens or going being new portal to dimension.

Aliens have been around since ancient times. Google old paintings with aliens and ufo's. What you see depicted is what we're seeing now with the release of the declassified "Tic Tac" ufo footage from the Navy jet fighter. All I'm saying is Steve is an alien, and he's on the run from space pirates. Don't go into the light when you're out in the badlands at night.

They could abduct you in your sleep so you wake up in a random location lol.

crocodiles are aggressive by nature but can be tamed. every 10 minutes their teeth fall out and new ones grow in their place. Crocodile teeth are used to make armor that allows you to swim quickly underwater, and swords, among other tools. maybe even a crocodile tooth can be combined with a mace for a better weapon against that particular crowd.

Thanks for updating your post!
I like the original texture.
Mostly likely yes, beyond cosmetic changes, i will update this post soon to go more in depth about gameplay mechanics aside from cosmetic changes. Thanks for suggesting the idea, Inkycatz.
No! I am afraid of Creepers! I don’t want them even scarier!

The "Camouflage Creepers" idea is genius, and it needs to be added.

 

It should work like this: Whatever biome the creeper is in he matches to.

It's MineCraft's deadly chameleon.

 

He leaves a plains(green) and goes into a desert, he turns yellowish like the sand. And so forth for other biomes.

This would be a genius addon to the game because he's "the creeper". He has a player's footsteps sound, doesn't make any other until he's gonna explode, and now he would have biome camo.

 

Please add this already.

I can agree with your ideas if the spawnrate is set down. Because Creepers are such a common mob, they are already very dangerous to every player and even their goods! If the spawnrate of Creepers would be set down, they could become a fantastic and camouflaged mob, because otherwise they would most certainly be too overpowered.
Ekeskwkkskdkssmd,d,d,f,c,cold,dls,slala.al
I love the idea of Creepers having a camo ability but just let it have no effects.

Good idea. I think creepers need an update. They're as bright as the grass textures were in the early days of minecraft. You can easily spot a creeper these days. Making creepers blend into the environment would help keep players on their toes and to be alert. In deserts creepers should look like cacti or dead bushes. In tundras they should look almost as white as snow. etc.

Yes I think camouflaged creepers would be really cool. Having them spáwn with a camouflage based on their biome of origin would be pretty awesome.

Since I think these a little too OP for common Overworld mobs, I think this should be a rarer creeper variant that takes a portion of normal creeper spawning rather than just all creepers having that. Not only that but common creepers are already too iconic to simply change forever. Camo creepers sound like a good name for these variant creepers.

Also, I wanted to add difficulty differences. In Easy, these creepers would be very rare and only be a few percent of creeper spawning. On Hard, most creepers would be camouflaged and normal creepers would actually be uncommon. Local difficulty could also change the chance of camo creepers to spawn just like it does with a few other factors.

EDIT: I think to make it more unique then simply camouflaged creepers, I wanted to add that I think they should use the same pallete as leaves from the biome they spawned in. This way it makes more sense lore wise as creepers are described as "leafy-like". I also don't think they should change colors based on biome, they are not chameleons, they simply spawn with colors based on where they originated from, so a desert creeper is always a desert creeper regardless of where it goes. it would also be much easier to implement if they just spawned a way and stayed like that forever.

The game has no way to scan what skin a player has, and if it did, would it only be able to scan an exact specific pre made skin, or would it be able to interpret the players skin some how? not to mention the elephant in the room, that would bring extremely op advantages to players that have said skins in single player or PvE, not to mention the extensively unbalanced advantages in PvP
Maybe make it armor instead of skins.

Could you add a picture of what these fish look like in real life? I imagine most people, like myself, do not know what they look like. Also, tell us, what is its sad history?

Having a fish be tamable is a silly idea but the fact that it can breathe out of water would make for an interesting new mechanic, which I do really like the sound of.

Edit: that is a gorgeous fish, I love it

This reminds of Aurora and Simon the betta fish. Simon died of sickness and Aurora was shocked to death by the temperature being to hot. They were at my school. I got very sad

This is a great idea! My betta loves to watch me play minecraft! He will lay on his lily pad or leaf hammock and watch the screen. Maybe they could have a kind of passive attack on other fish like wolves do with sheep, since they like to attack other fish! They could be useful in protecting underwater bases passively since the axolotl has to have fish in the players hand to attack (or I could be remembering their attack thingy wrong xD)

Cool idea!  It's true that the terracotta biome needs more stuff added, since it's so rare terracotta soldiers would greatly improve upon it!  Although I don't think terracotta should be stronger than diamonds, but terracotta blocks would look cool, so would terracotta horse armour.  I think 6o hits is a bit overkill, 6 would be a sufficient challenge.  How about when it takes fire damage it gets a "hardened" buff that would lower damage to it, you could put terracotta equipment in a furnace to make hardened terracotta equipment.  

 

Btw, cool Chinese history reference to the terracotta army!

I think it should be stronger than iron but weaker than gold. Nothing should be stronger than diamond, especially not terracotta, which is much easier to obtain. If I found a plains village, I could break their walls and make some armor and tools and never even need to get diamonds.
I don’t think the terra cotta sword being stronger than diamond should be a thing maybe like iron or less.
If not in regular Minecraft, I want to at least see them in a Minecraft Dungeons DLC.
